availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. McGehee (Fulton County, Kentucky, farm laborer)

body.p: Fulton County, Kentucky, farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Elizabeth Workman McGeehee Tyler. Stepson of James P. Tyler. Student in Fulton County in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Fulton County in 1850. Student and farm laborer for his mother in Fulton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 138A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 933.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, Hickman, p. 416.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Fulton County Marriages, 1845-1875, Film #000321403, p. 231 of 521 of microfilm.
